original: @265a rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @265a rgya gar skad du /

analyzed: a'arya n'i lam ba ra dha ra badzra p'a ni kalpa n'a ma dh'a ra ni /

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /

original: 'phags pa lag na rdo rje gos sngon po can gyi cho ga zhes bya ba'i gzungs /
analyzed: 'phags pa lag na rdo rje gos sngon po can gyi cho ga zhes bya ba'i gzungs /
translated: The Dharani called the Ritual of the Noble Vajrapani, the Blue-Clad

original: dkon @265b mchog gsum la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: dkon @265b mchog gsum la phyag 'tshal lo //

original: gnod sbyin gyi sde dpon chen po lag na rdo rje gos sngon po can /
analyzed: gnod sbyin gyi sde dpon chen po lag na rdo rje gos sngon po can /
translated: The great Yaksha general Vajrapani, the Blue-Clad,

original: sangs rgyas gang g'a'i klung gi bye ba phrag 'bum gyi bye ma snyed kyis rjes su gnang ba /
analyzed: sangs rgyas gang g'a'i klung gi bye ba phrag 'bum gyi bye ma snyed kyis rjes su gnang ba /
translated: who has been authorized by as many Buddhas as there are grains of sand in the Ganges river,

original: mche ba gtsigs pa dang 'tsham pa /
analyzed: mche ba gtsigs pa dang 'tsham pa /

original: mig me mdag gi phung po 'dra ba /
analyzed: mig me mdag gi phung po 'dra ba /
translated: eyes like a mass of burning embers,

original: dbugs me lce ltar 'bar ba /
analyzed: dbugs me lce ltar 'bar ba /
translated: breath blazing like tongues of fire,

original: 'jigs pa'i nga ro can /
analyzed: 'jigs pa'i nga ro can /

original: lag pa dang / rkang pa klu nor rgyas kyi bus brgyan pa /
analyzed: lag pa dang / rkang pa klu nor rgyas kyi bus brgyan pa /
translated: hands and feet adorned with the Naga Vairambha,

original: klu nag po se ral khar thogs pa /
analyzed: klu nag po se ral khar thogs pa /
translated: with a black Naga held under his arm,

original: klu dga' bo dang / nye dga' bo 'bar bas rna cha byas pa /
analyzed: klu dga' bo dang / nye dga' bo 'bar bas rna cha byas pa /
translated: with the blazing Nagas Nanda and Upananda as earrings,

original: sbrul 'bar ba'i rin po che'i cod pan thogs pa /
analyzed: sbrul 'bar ba'i rin po che'i cod pan thogs pa /
translated: wearing a crown of blazing snakes,

original: sbrul gdug pa 'bar ba za ba /
analyzed: sbrul gdug pa 'bar ba za ba /

original: bzhin rgyas pa /🔽smin ma dang / dpral ba bsdus pa /
analyzed: bzhin rgyas pa / smin ma dang / dpral ba bsdus pa /
translated: His face is full.🔽His eyebrows and forehead are furrowed.

original: ya sos ma mchu mnan pa /
analyzed: ya sos ma mchu mnan pa /
translated: His upper teeth bite his lower lip.

original: gshin rje'i cha byad can /
analyzed: gshin rje'i cha byad can /
translated: He has the appearance of Yama.

original: lce glog ltar 'gyu ba /
analyzed: lce glog ltar 'gyu ba /

original: gsus po che sbrul za ba /
analyzed: gsus po che sbrul za ba /

original: lag pa brdabs pa'i sgras 'jigs par byed pa /
analyzed: lag pa brdabs pa'i sgras 'jigs par byed pa /
translated: The sound of his clapping hands terrifies.

original: klu'i rgyal po 'dab bzang ske rags su bcings pa /
analyzed: klu'i rgyal po 'dab bzang ske rags su bcings pa /
translated: The nāga king Suparṇa is bound as his belt.

original: aa la la zhes sgrog par byed pa /
analyzed: aa la la zhes sgrog par byed pa /

original: rgya mtsho'i zabs su dpag tshad brgyad khri yod pa rkang ba'i pus mor phyin pa /
analyzed: rgya mtsho'i zabs su dpag tshad brgyad khri yod pa rkang ba'i pus mor phyin pa /
translated: He reaches down to the ocean’s depth of eighty thousand fathoms with his knees.

original: dbang po dang / nyi ma phrag pa la bkur ba /
analyzed: dbang po dang / nyi ma phrag pa la bkur ba /
translated: Indra and the sun are carried on his shoulders.

original: klu thams cad rlag par byed pa /
analyzed: klu thams cad rlag par byed pa /

original: gad rgyangs chen po sgrogs pas kun tu 'khrugs par byed pa /
analyzed: gad rgyangs chen po sgrogs pas kun tu 'khrugs par byed pa /
translated: He causes great laughter and agitation.

original: gshin rje'i gzugs can /
analyzed: gshin rje'i gzugs can /
translated: He has the form of Yama.

original: khams gsum pa 'jigs par byed pa /
analyzed: khams gsum pa 'jigs par byed pa /

original: klu rnams 'chi bar byed pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: klu rnams 'chi bar byed pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the one who causes the nāgas to die.

original: de nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang g'a'i klung gi bya @266a *//
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang g'a'i klung gi bya @266a *//
translated: Then the blessed buddhas of the Gaṅgā river sands

analyzed: ma snyed kyis gsungs pa'i rig sngags 'di brjod par bya'o //
translated: One should recite this knowledge mantra spoken by the Blessed One.🔽Tadyathā:

analyzed: tadya th'a / bho bho pan n'a ga /

analyzed: bhinda bhinda / n'a ga marm'a ni bi she manda /

analyzed: n'a ga bi d'a r'a ya h'um phat/ n'a ga got s'a da n'a ya phat/

analyzed: n'i l'am ba sa n'a ya phat/

analyzed: bi n'a sha k'a r'a ya phat/

analyzed: dha ra dha ra /

analyzed: m'a ra ya m'a ra ya /

analyzed: n'a sha ya n'a sha ya /

analyzed: sarba bighnam bi n'a sha ka r'a ya phat/

original: sarba sha trum sam brtan bi n'a sha ka r'a ya phat/
analyzed: sarba sha trum sam brtan bi n'a sha ka r'a ya phat/

analyzed: n'i l'amba ra dha ra /

original: badzra p'a ni radzny'a pa ya ti sv'ah'a /
analyzed: badzra p'a ni radzny'a pa ya ti sv'ah'a /

original: de'i cho ga la /
analyzed: de'i cho ga la /
translated: The ritual for this is as follows:

original: gnod sbyin gyis zin pa la ni /
analyzed: gnod sbyin gyis zin pa la ni /
translated: For one seized by a yakṣa,

original: chu la sngags kyis btab la gtor na btang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chu la sngags kyis btab la gtor na btang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: sprinkle water enchanted with the mantra and they will be released.

original: klu bzlog par bya na /🔽smyug shad kyi lcug ma'am /
analyzed: klu bzlog par bya na / smyug shad kyi lcug ma'am /
translated: If you want to avert a nāga,🔽use a bamboo cane

original: bal po se'u yi lcug mas bya'o //
analyzed: bal po se'u yi lcug mas bya'o //

original: yi dvags dang / brjed byed rnams la ni skud pas bya'o //
analyzed: yi dvags dang / brjed byed rnams la ni skud pas bya'o //
translated: For pretas and epilepsy, use a thread.

original: @266b rims nad med par bya ba dang / gzhogs phyed na ba dang / yi ga 'chus pa la ni skud pa sngon pos bya'o //
analyzed: @266b rims nad med par bya ba dang / gzhogs phyed na ba dang / yi ga 'chus pa la ni skud pa sngon pos bya'o //
translated: For those who are afflicted by a fever, a paralysis, or a loss of appetite, one should use a blue thread.

original: nor 'dod na zhag gcig smyung ba byas te /
analyzed: nor 'dod na zhag gcig smyung ba byas te /
translated: If one desires wealth, one should fast for one day and

original: 'og phor gyis bdugs na rmi  lam du dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i don thams cad ston la gser gyi dong tse bdun stong sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: 'og phor gyis bdugs na rmi  lam du dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i don thams cad ston la gser gyi dong tse bdun stong sbyin par byed do //
translated: fumigate with the ash of cow dung. In one’s dream, it will show all that is auspicious and inauspicious, and one will receive seven thousand golden coins.

original: rgyas btab pa dkrol bar 'dod na thal bas bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas btab pa dkrol bar 'dod na thal bas bya'o //
translated: If one wishes to open a seal, one should use ash.

original: sgo lcags dbye bar 'dod na yungs kar gyis bya'o //
analyzed: sgo lcags dbye bar 'dod na yungs kar gyis bya'o //
translated: If one wishes to open a lock, one should use white mustard seeds.

original: 'jigs pa thams cad las srung ba'i las ni mar rnying pa'am /
analyzed: 'jigs pa thams cad las srung ba'i las ni mar rnying pa'am /
translated: The rite for protection from all fears is performed with old butter,

original: thal ba'am / yungs kar gyis bya'o //
analyzed: thal ba'am / yungs kar gyis bya'o //

original: nad kyis 'jigs pa thams cad la ni skud pa sngon po las bsrung ba'i mdud pa byas te /
analyzed: nad kyis 'jigs pa thams cad la ni skud pa sngon po las bsrung ba'i mdud pa byas te /
translated: For all fears of illness, one should make a protection knot with a blue thread.

original: mgul du btags na bsrung ba'i mchog tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mgul du btags na bsrung ba'i mchog tu 'gyur ro //
translated: If one ties it around one’s neck, it will become the supreme protection.

original: byis pa gdon gyis nyen pa thams cad la ni tshon sna lnga'i skud pa mgul du btags na bsrung pa'i mchog tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byis pa gdon gyis nyen pa thams cad la ni tshon sna lnga'i skud pa mgul du btags na bsrung pa'i mchog tu 'gyur ro //
translated: For all children afflicted by spirits, it is the supreme protection to tie a five-colored thread around their neck.

original: chom rkun bzlog par 'dod na sas bya'o //
analyzed: chom rkun bzlog par 'dod na sas bya'o //
translated: If one wishes to ward off thieves, one should do it with earth.

original: dug la ni rtsa ku shas byab par bya'o //
analyzed: dug la ni rtsa ku shas byab par bya'o //
translated: For poison, one should sprinkle with kuśa grass.

original: bdag bsrung ba la ni yid kyis sam /
analyzed: bdag bsrung ba la ni yid kyis sam /
translated: For one's own protection, one should do it mentally.

original: chus bya'o // gzhan bsrung ba la ni skud pa sngon pos bya'o //
analyzed: chus bya'o // gzhan bsrung ba la ni skud pa sngon pos bya'o //
translated: For protecting others, one should do it with a blue thread.

original: las de thams cad la sngags brjod pa ni /
analyzed: las de thams cad la sngags brjod pa ni /
translated: In all those rites, the recitation of the mantra

original: sngags lan gsum mam /
analyzed: sngags lan gsum mam /
translated: should be done three times,🔽or seven times,

original: bdun nam / bcu bzhi 'am /
analyzed: bdun nam / bcu bzhi 'am /

original: nyi shu rtsa gcig gam /
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa gcig gam /

original: brgya rtsa brgyad par bya'o //
analyzed: brgya rtsa brgyad par bya'o //
translated: or one hundred and eight times.

original: de ltar byas na 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar byas na 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does it in that way, it will be accomplished.

original: mchod rten sku gdung ldan pa'i drung du /
analyzed: mchod rten sku gdung ldan pa'i drung du /
translated: In front of a stūpa with relics,

original: me tog sngon pos mchod ste /
analyzed: me tog sngon pos mchod ste /
translated: one should make offerings with blue flowers.

original: sngags stong bzlas brjod byas na @267a *//
analyzed: sngags stong bzlas brjod byas na @267a *//
translated: If one recites the mantra one thousand times,

original: 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'grub par 'gyur ro //

original: 'phags pa lag na rdo rje gos sngon po can zhes bya ba'i gzungs rdzogs so ////
analyzed: 'phags pa lag na rdo rje gos sngon po can zhes bya ba'i gzungs rdzogs so ////
translated: The Dhāraṇī of Noble Vajrapāṇi, the One with Blue Garments, is complete.

original: rgya gar gyi mkhan po dzny'a na garbha dang; lo tstsha ba bandhe klu'i dbang pos bsgyur //
analyzed: rgya gar gyi mkhan po dzny'a na garbha dang; lo tstsha ba bandhe klu'i dbang pos bsgyur //
translated: The Indian abbot Jñānagarbha and the translator Bandhe Klu’i dbang po translated it.
